addressleaf.section:
18 A
p
1590
M
r
Bodeley to
e LL
of
e Counsell./

To the right honorable the Lordes and others of
her Ma
ties
most honorable privy councel

page.lettertext:
fol.43r
It may please yo
r
LL. to be advertised, that I
have perfourmed
e charge of yo
r
letters of the
15. of Marche, whiche came unto my handes the
4. of this present. About
e principal pointes I
had only to deale w
t
the
General States
: whiche,
by vertu of yo
r
LL. letter of credence, I have ac-
complished, and have sent yo
w
the copie of that
Proposition, which I made unto them. Their
present Answear is no other, but
at they will deli-
berat uppon it: albeit I see no apparance of any
speedy resolution: especially for that it seemeth heere
they knowe not howe farre they may yelde in establi-
shing
e autoritie of
e
Councel of State
. They are
still solicited about it, not only by me, in her Ma
ties
name, but also by
e rest of this Councel, in the
behalf of
e Contrey. And though it be a mater
most plainely sette downe in
e Treaty, and would
be a singular meanes, to redresse
e disorders of
this diseased state; yet
e general states have so
long usurped
at autoritie, and some particular
persons doe finde it suche a special furtherance to
their privat deseignes, as it is very muche douted,
unles her Ma
tie
will take
e same to hart, they
will never but delay, and dalley away in wordes,
whatsoever is demaunded. Those other
pointes of yo
r
letter, whiche I have not touched
in my speeche to
e General States, are maters
appertening to
e Councel of State, to whome they
shall be imparted w
t
e next opportunitie, and
as their answear shall require, I will advertise
yo
r
LL.
Wherew
t
I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. A
p
18. 1590.
Yo
r
L. most humble
at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley.
